properties.Name: LifeInsuranceClaimType
properties.Description:
The type of claim filed.

Ex.:
- Death Claim
- Maturity Claim
- Survival Claim

where:
Death Claim:
When the insured dies, the amount of money payable to their family is called a death claim.

Maturity Claim:
When the policy completes its tenure, the maturity claim amount is settled towards the life assured. 

Survival Claim:
When money is due to the policy holder before the policy matures, provided they are alive, is called a survival claim.

Columns.Name: LifeInsuranceClaimTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Life Insurance Claim Type.

Columns.Name: LifeInsuranceClaimTypeName
Columns.Description: The name of a Life Insurance Claim Type.

Columns.Name: LifeInsuranceClaimTypeDescription
Columns.Description: The description of a Life Insurance Claim Type.
